sn56.57:1.1: “Mendicants, suppose a man was to draw up two or three drops of water from the ocean.
sn56.57:1.3: Which is more: the two or three drops drawn out or the water in the ocean?”
sn56.57:1.4: “Sir, the water in the ocean is certainly more. The two or three drops drawn out are tiny.
sn56.57:1.5: Compared to the water in the ocean, it can’t be reckoned or compared, it’s not even a fraction.”
sn56.57:1.6: “In the same way, for a noble disciple …
sn56.57:1.7: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
